item.title: Building Public Infrastructure with Autosustainble Services
item.description:
Description

Five years ago, I realized we needed a vehicle other than startups to build sustainable open source services. This need came from my own problem of building lots and lots of simple services (usually in Python) and not having the time or desire to build a business around them. These services include Localtunnel, RequestBin, Airscript, and others. Here I'll show these projects, their place in the ecosystem, and what I plan to do about making them sustainable.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Lindsay

item.title: Throwing Together Distributed Services With Gevent
item.description:
Summary

In this talk we learn how to throw together a distributed system using gevent and a simple framework called gservice. We'll go from nothing to a distributed messaging system ready for production deployment based on experiences building scalable, distributed systems at Twilio.
